meanings.definition: The earliest stage of development in an organism or structure.
meanings.sent1: In the primordia of the plant, tiny buds started to form.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the primordia of embryos to understand growth processes.
meanings.sent3: The primordia of the cake mix were just flour and sugar, waiting to become a delicious dessert.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for art was the primordia of her successful career as a painter.
meanings.sent5: The primordia of the seed held the potential for a beautiful flower to bloom.

meanings.definition: The first elements or beginnings of something.
meanings.sent1: The primordia of the story were evident in the opening paragraph.
meanings.sent2: The primordia of the friendship between the two children started with a shared love for dinosaurs.
meanings.sent3: The primordia of the puzzle were scattered pieces waiting to be put together.
meanings.sent4: His kindness and generosity were the primordia of his reputation as a helpful neighbor.
meanings.sent5: The primordia of the storm could be seen in the dark clouds gathering on the horizon.
